# Edward Manteuffel-Szoege

| birth_place      = Rezhitsa, Vitebsk Governorate, Russian Empire
| death_date       =
| death_place      = Kharkov, Ukrainian SSR, USSR
}}
Edward Manteuffel-Szoege (born Edward Antoni Manteuffel, 5 July 1908 â€“ 1940) was a Polish artist. He competed in the art competitions at the 1936 Summer Olympics. After the outbreak of the Second World War, Manteuffel-Szoege was arrested by the NKVD. In 1940, he was murdered by the Soviets.
